description:
8.112 stereowiden
This filter enhance the stereo effect by suppressing signal common to both
channels and by delaying the signal of left into right and vice versa,
thereby widening the stereo effect.

The filter accepts the following options:

crossfeed.description: Cross feed of left into right with inverted phase.

delay.description: Time in milliseconds of the delay of left signal into right and vice versa.

drymix.description: Set level of input signal of original channel.

feedback.description: Amount of gain in delayed signal into right and vice versa.

name: stereowiden

parameters.name: feedback

parameters.description: Cross feed of left into right with inverted phase. This helps in suppressing the mono. If the value is 1 it will cancel all the signal common to both channels. Default is 0.3.

parameters.description: Set level of input signal of original channel. Default is 0.8.

source:
8.112 stereowiden

This filter enhance the stereo effect by suppressing signal common to both channels and by delaying the signal of left into right and vice versa, thereby widening the stereo effect.

The filter accepts the following options:

delay

Time in milliseconds of the delay of left signal into right and vice versa. Default is 20 milliseconds.

feedback

Amount of gain in delayed signal into right and vice versa. Gives a delay effect of left signal in right output and vice versa which gives widening effect. Default is 0.3.

crossfeed

Cross feed of left into right with inverted phase. This helps in suppressing the mono. If the value is 1 it will cancel all the signal common to both channels. Default is 0.3.

drymix

Set level of input signal of original channel. Default is 0.8.
